biographical_notes:
Born and raised on Kauaʻi. Graduated Kapa'a High School on Kauaʻi. Continued at Kaua'i Community College. Deeply rooted in her Kānaka Maoli heritage.
She is both composer and singer. She has released several albums (including Naʻu ʻOe (2003), ʻŌhai ʻUla (2010), Waipunalei (2021)) and has won multiple Nā Hōkū Hanohano Awards, including Album of Year, Female Vocalist, and Haku Mele of the Year.
In addition to composing and performing, she serves as educator/lecturer. She works with Hawaiian language revitalization. Her compositions appear in media (films, documentaries, TV) and she has responsibility as cultural bearer.
